org.xlbean.xlscript.script

Class XlScriptFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlbean.xlscript.script.XlScriptFactory

  • public class XlScriptFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory for XlScript.

    Concept of XlScript is a simple wrapper of Groovy Script instance. Since Script instance contains logics as well as contexts, xlscript by default creates XlScript instance for every execution of scripts even if scriptText is exactly the same. This behavior can be changed by cacheScript flag.

    On creating XlScript instance, by default this factory uses plain GroovyShell instance to parse @scriptText. But if baseScript or baseInstance is set, then set them as DelegatingScript of GroovyShell so that scriptText can access these base logics from the script. Since only one delegate can be configured, this class expects either of the base is set. If both are set, baseScript will be used.

      • getXlScript

        public XlScript getXlScript(java.lang.String scriptText,
                            java.lang.String sharedContextName,
                            boolean cacheScript)
        Parse scriptText to create Script instance, wrap the script by XlScript and return.

        sharedContextName is used to share GroovyShell instance between scriptText. For the same sharedContextName, the same GroovyShell instance to parse scriptText. Let's assume you have 2 different scripts "def val = 1" and "println val", and you want to execute the second script in the same memory space as the first one. In that case, invoke this method with the same sharedContextName for the different scripts then the 2 XlScript instances will share the memory space so that the second script will write "1" to stdout.

        When cacheScript is true, XlScript instance for scriptText will be cached and reused. You can expect around 100 times better performance by caching XlScript instance, however using the same XlScript instance means that subsequent execution can be impacted by the previous one so be careful when enabling caching.

        Parameters:
        scriptText -
        sharedContextName -
        cacheScript -
        Returns:
